result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilberto Ayala Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Reyes appeared by video for Gilberto Ayala Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski sworn. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Reyes appeared by video for Gilberto Ayala Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Patrick O. Ryan who appeared by video.
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has completed a TAD evaluation. State requests time to review the TAD evaluation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Reyes appeared by video for Gilberto Ayala Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation completed. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case is tabbed to Judge Havas, Br. 10 in error.  Case is being retabbed to Judge Richard's court.  Case is adjourned to 9-8-22 at 8:30 am for pretrial conference before Judge Richards.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez in court with Attorney Michael Reyes.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense waives an interpreter for purposes of today's proceedings.  Court set a status date upon request from the defense.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067113,
Payable Number: 1020241,
Receipt Number: 22RP028825,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GGR.

Defendant Gilberto Ayala Ramirez in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi
Defendant is advised per the State that this case is re-assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-29-2022 @1p
